title: task

title: task

title: task

title: task
description: Verify and tighten auth bypass, signed cookies, and real Clerk login stories.

title: task
description: Unit tests for token signing, env templating, deterministic executor, and triage plan generation.

title: Fix UISmoke Agent Harness Failures
description: Critical fixes for run_prime_smoke.py and GLMVisionClient to enable automated QA. See uismoke_harness_failure_report.md for details.

title: Fix AgentStory Pydantic Validation for String Steps
UISmoke Agent: Story format inconsistency (Pydantic vs dataclass)
description:
## Problem
The UISmoke agent has two different story model representations:
- Pydantic models in `schemas.py` (AgentStory, StoryResult, StepResult, SmokeRunReport)
- Dataclass models in `models.py` (Story, StoryResult, StepResult, SmokeRunReport)

This causes:
1. Confusion about which models to use
2. JSON serialization issues (dataclasses need custom serialization)
3. Inconsistent behavior across different components

## Root Cause
During the v0.5.0 refactor, Pydantic schemas were introduced in `schemas.py` but the old dataclass models in `models.py` were kept for backward compatibility.

## Tasks
1. Decide on canonical model format (Pydantic vs dataclass)
2. Migrate all consumers to use the canonical format
3. Deprecate/remove the old model format
4. Update documentation to reflect the change

title: Standardize story models to Pydantic (schemas.py)
description:
Migrate all consumers from dataclass models (models.py) to Pydantic schemas (schemas.py). This includes:
- Update run_prime_smoke.py to use AgentStory from schemas.py
- Update ui_smoke_agent.py to use consistent models
- Remove or deprecate old dataclass models

title: Integrate context pointers into ToolContextManager
description: Wire FileContextPointerStore + ContextRelevanceSelector into llm_common.agents.ToolContextManager so apps can load selected tool outputs instead of dumping all context.

title: DOCS/BEADS: Issue hygiene + jules packets
description: Close confirmed-stale issues and create docs packets/tech plans for all P0/P1 + jules-ready + needs-user-input items.

title: SHARED_AGENT_CONTRACTS_AND_PRIMITIVES
description: llm-common workstream for shared agent/runtime contract unification across affordabot + prime-radiant-ai. Focus: stable contracts (ToolResult/provenance, optional StreamEvent), shared primitives (ToolSelector, pointer store), versioning, and publish pinned releases.

title: DOCS_FRONTEND_UNIFICATION_WORKSTREAM
description: Create llm-common workstream spec for frontend stack unification and agent contract stabilization; includes Jules-dispatchable tasks and dependency mapping.
notes: Initialized Beads in llm-common; mirroring canonical spec and creating contract/release tasks.

title: DEXTER_PORTS_CORE_PRIMITIVES
description: Provide shared, reusable implementations of Dexter portability wins in llm-common: (1) Tool selection helper and config (default glm-4.5-air), (2) context pointer store + relevance selection, (3) MessageHistory summaries + relevance selection. Apps consume via tagged release.
notes: Jules-Ready: partial (umbrella integration tracker). Dispatch: docs/bd-llm-common-cmm/JULES_DISPATCH.md. Prefer dispatching child tasks first (llm-common-cmm.11, llm-common-cmm.12).

title: TOOL_SELECTION_HELPER_AND_MODEL_CONFIG
description: Add a shared ToolSelector helper to llm-common: schema-grounded tool selection using a dedicated small model (default: glm-4.5-air). Provide a stable config surface (env vars) and tests.

title: CONTEXT_POINTER_STORE_AND_RELEVANCE_SELECTION_LIBRARY
description: Provide a shared context pointer store + relevance selection helper in llm-common (Dexter-style), so both apps share storage format and selection logic.

title: CONTRACT_TOOLRESULT_PROVENANCE
description: Stabilize ToolResult + provenance/evidence contract used by app frontends.

title: CONTRACT_STREAM_EVENT_SCHEMA_OPTIONAL
description: Define optional streaming event contract (StreamEvent) shared across apps if/when streaming is enabled.

title: RELEASE_AND_PINNING_PLAN
description: Cut llm-common release tag and provide pinning instructions for affordabot/prime; eliminate branch-based pins.

title: DEXTER_AUDIT_REFRESH_AND_REWRITE_SPEC_UPDATES
description: Refresh and expand the Dexter audit (local ~/dexter) and update llm-common-cmm workstream spec with missed integration ideas + low-hanging fruit (contracts, provenance, context selection, message history). Docs-only PR.

title: LLM_COMMON_VERSION_TAG_ALIGNMENT
description: Align llm-common pyproject.toml version with the latest released tag and define a single release/versioning source of truth.

title: LLM_COMMON_PUBLISH_JSON_SCHEMA_ARTIFACTS
description: Publish JSON Schema artifacts for canonical contracts (advisor request/response envelope, EvidenceEnvelope, StreamEvent optional) as part of llm-common releases.

title: LLM_COMMON_MESSAGE_HISTORY_HELPER
description: Implement a Dexter-style MessageHistory helper: summarize answers and select relevant prior turns via structured output. Keep it optional and backend-agnostic.
notes: Library implemented + merged (llm-common#39). Released as llm-common v0.7.5 tag. Remaining acceptance: demonstrate usage in an app (tracking in prime-radiant-ai bd-d7l7 / Jules session 15760309866269394898).

title: DEXTER_PORTS_BUNDLE_SPEC_AND_TASKS
description: Docs-only: bundle Dexter port ideas (small-model tool selection via glm-4.5-air, context pointer store+relevance selection, message history summaries) into llm-common workstream spec with Jules-ready tasks.

title: UISmoke Agent: Critical fixes for runner harness
description:
## Context
These issues were discovered and fixed during smoke test validation.

## Issues Fixed (Code Changes Made)
1. **extra_body conflict** - ZaiClient was passing extra_body inline AND via **kwargs, causing 'multiple values for keyword' error
2. **GLMVisionClient.close() missing** - No method to properly close AsyncOpenAI client
3. **load_story not exported** - Story loading function not accessible from llm_common.agents
4. **goals->steps mapping** - load_stories_from_directory didn't handle legacy 'goals' format

## Remaining Tasks
1. [ ] Verify fixes with actual smoke test run
2. [ ] Update documentation for new story format support
3. [ ] Consider deprecating dataclass models (see epic llm-common-1pf)

title: Dexter RAG V2: llm-common Upgrade
description: Port Dexter's agentic patterns to llm-common: UnderstandPhase, ReflectPhase, IterativeOrchestrator, and streaming enhancements. Foundation for Prime Radiant and Affordabot RAG integration.

title: A1: UnderstandPhase
description: Create UnderstandPhase for intent/entity extraction. JULES_READY=true. Tasks: A1.1-A1.6 (schemas, implementation, tests). Est: 2h

title: A2: ReflectPhase
description: Create ReflectPhase for completeness evaluation with 2-iteration limit. JULES_READY=true. Tasks: A2.1-A2.6 (schemas, implementation, tests). Est: 2.5h

title: B1: IterativeOrchestrator
description: Full Dexter-style orchestrator with Understand->Plan->Execute->Reflect loop. Depends on A1+A2. Tasks: B1.1-B1.7. Est: 4.5h

title: C1: ZaiClient Streaming Enhancement
description: Add tool_stream=True for GLM-4.7, handle reasoning_content and delta.tool_calls. JULES_READY=true. Tasks: C1.1-C1.6. Est: 2.5h

title: C2: Exports and Release v0.5.0
description: Update __init__.py exports, bump version, update CHANGELOG. Tasks: C2.1-C2.5. Est: 1h

title: Fix duplicate pyyaml in pyproject.toml (breaks Poetry installs)
description: pyproject.toml contains duplicate pyyaml dependency (required + optional), causing TOMLDecodeError 'Cannot overwrite a value'. Blocks downstream repos from updating llm-common.

title: epic
description: Refining QA loop rigor with strict classification, exclude-stories support, and deterministic Plaid support.

title: Fix GLMVisionClient extra_body and close methods
llm-uismoke-qa-loop
description: Complete the UISmoke QA Loop so it reliably supports HITL bug-fixing.

title: UISmoke QA harness vNext (runner+artifacts+auth+network)
description:
# Context
UISmokeAgent exists, but each application repo (prime-radiant-ai, affordabot) has grown bespoke Playwright runners/adapters and inconsistent reporting.

# Goal
Make `llm-common` the single canonical QA-engineer harness:
- Run all YAML stories in a directory, one-by-one
- Keep running after failures; strict suite/global timeouts
- Produce durable, per-story artifacts (screenshots/HTML/trace/network/console) + a structured JSON/MD report
- Provide auth/persona session management and network stability controls so dev/PR environments are testable

# Non-Goals
- Automatically creating Beads issues from failures (later)
- Fixing product bugs in apps (downstream)

# Deliverables
- Canonical runner API + CLI entrypoint
- Canonical Playwright adapter (BrowserAdapter) in llm-common
- Auth strategies (cookie bypass + UI login + storage_state)
- Network policy (block analytics, retry navigation, avoid `networkidle`)
- Artifact schema + directory layout contract
- Integration docs for Prime Radiant + Affordabot

# Acceptance Criteria
- A single command can run a story directory and generate `run.json` + `run.md` and per-story evidence folders.
- Status model distinguishes: `pass`, `fail`, `timeout`, `not_run` (and includes reason codes like `story_timeout`, `suite_timeout`, `auth_failed`).
- Runner supports persona/session policies: shared context vs per-persona contexts (guest vs authed).
- Both prime-radiant-ai and affordabot can adopt without maintaining their own runners.

title: Define runner API + artifact contract (v1)
description:
# Deliverable
Define the v1 contract consumed by app repos:
- CLI: `uismoke run --stories <dir> --base-url <url> --output <dir> [--auth <mode>] [--suite-timeout] [--story-timeout] ...`
- JSON schema for `run.json` and per-story `story.json`
- Evidence directory layout

# Acceptance Criteria
- Contract document checked into `llm_common/contracts/` (or `docs/`) and referenced by docs.
- Contract explicitly includes persona/auth and network policy knobs.

title: Implement canonical Playwright BrowserAdapter + network policy
description:
# Deliverable
A llm-common Playwright adapter implementing `llm_common.agents.ui_smoke_agent.BrowserAdapter` plus:
- configurable nav/action timeouts
- `domcontentloaded` navigation (no `networkidle`)
- optional request interception (blocklist/allowlist, fulfill stubs)
- console/network logging capture
- optional tracing/HAR/video wiring

# Acceptance Criteria
- Adapter is importable from llm-common and used by the runner.
- Default policy blocks common analytics domains and avoids indefinite waits.

title: Auth + persona session strategies
description:
# Deliverable
Auth strategies usable across repos:
- `cookie_bypass` (configurable cookie name/value, host allowlist)
- `ui_login` (Clerk email/password, best-effort)
- `storage_state` reuse

Persona/session policy:
- separate contexts for guest vs authed stories
- ability to force new context per story for isolation

# Acceptance Criteria
- Runner can execute a mix of guest+authed stories without invalidating guest coverage.
- When auth fails, authed stories become `not_run` with reason `auth_failed`, but guest stories still run.

title: Runner implementation (timeouts, continue-on-fail, artifacts)
description:
# Deliverable
Implement the canonical runner:
- loads stories via `llm_common.agents.utils.load_stories_from_directory`
- runs stories sequentially with per-story + suite timeout
- continues after failures
- writes artifacts to disk:
  - per-story folder (html/png from UISmokeAgent, plus trace/network/console summaries)
  - `run.json` and `run.md`

# Acceptance Criteria
- Running against a URL produces deterministic, inspectable artifacts.
- `run.json` includes summary counts + per-story status + reason codes.
- Exit code non-zero if any story != pass.

title: Integration docs + migration guide (Prime + Affordabot)
description:
# Deliverable
Docs showing how to adopt the runner in each repo:
- required env vars
- recommended auth strategy per env (dev/PR/local)
- expected artifacts
- troubleshooting for Clerk/network issues

title: Release version + update exports
description:
# Deliverable
Cut a llm-common release and ensure the runner/adapter are exported.

# Acceptance Criteria
- prime-radiant-ai and affordabot can pin a rev containing the runner.
